post.summary: Upsert a credential (names are unique per org)
Upsert a skill (names are unique per org)
Upsert a worker (names are unique per org)
Upsert a document_repository (names are unique per org)
Upsert a flow (names are unique per org)

flow.title: Flow
flow.description: A flow is a collection of objects and their relationship that define a process.

worker.title: Worker
worker.description: A worker is an integration to an endpoint that, when given the current context of a task execution, will provide text outputs or tool operations.

channelUserConfig.description: A map of channel types to channel user credential names

skills.description: The list of skills the worker has.

wipLimit.description: The number of tasks a worker can have in progress at a time.

document_repository.title: Document Repository
document_repository.description: A document repository is a repository that contains documents that can be used in tasks.

documentChunkStrategy.description: The strategy to use for chunking documents.

skill.title: Skill
skill.description: A skill is a capability that a worker can have and is used to match workers to tasks.

orgId.description: The unique identifier for the organization the object belongs to

channel.title: Channel
channel.description: A channel is a communication channel that can be used to communicate with workers.

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.description: Documentation defines the specific documents from a repository that are made available to a task.

repository.description: The name of the document repository to use.

documents.description: The list of documents from the repository to use. Null or Empty means all

resource.title: Resource
resource.description: A resource is an external, versionable static resource that can be retrieved or created. It can be used as both and input and output for tasks.

example.description: An example value of an output for the resource.

task.title: Task
task.description: A task is a unit of work that can be assigned to a worker. It should be a complete definition of all requirements in terms of tooling, integrations, and instructions.

requiredSkills.description: The list of skills needed for this task.

defaultChannel.description: The default channel to use for communication.

tracker.description: The Name of the tracker to use for execution.

documentation.description: The list of documentation names to use.

tools.description: The list of tools needed for this task.

triggers.description: The list of channels or resources to trigger the task.

inputs.description: The map of inputs for this task. Keys can be used in task templates using handlebars syntax. I.E., and input of message may map to a channel name, and then in the task template, you can use {{message}}

outputs.description: The list of outputs for this task.

subtasks.description: The list of subtasks for this task.

costLimit.description: The cost limit for each execution of this task.

tool.title: Tool
tool.description: A tool is an external integration that a worker may use during execution of a task.

channel.description: The channel for the tool to use for dynamic user interaction

tracker.title: Tracker
tracker.description: A tracker is a system that can be used to track the progress of a task execution.

webhooksEnabled.description: Whether or not webhooks are enabled for this tracker.

pollingInterval.description: The interval in seconds to poll for updates if webhooks are not enabled

discord_channel_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the discord-channel channel

native_channel_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the native-channel channel

slack_channel_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the slack-channel channel

channel_credential.title: channel Credential
channel_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

worker_discord_token_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the worker-discord-token channel_user_credential

worker_native_token_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the worker-native-token channel_user_credential

worker_slack_token_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the worker-slack-token channel_user_credential

channel_user_credential_credential.title: channel_user_credential Credential
channel_user_credential_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

default_documentation_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the default-documentation documentation

documentation_credential.title: documentation Credential
documentation_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

model_api_key.description: The API key for the model.

access_token.description: The token to use for authentication.

git_document_repository_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the git-document-repository document_repository

model_api_key.description: The API key for the model.

internal_document_repository_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the internal-document-repository document_repository

document_repository_credential.title: document_repository Credential
document_repository_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

custom_headers.description: Custom headers to include in the request. Provide a JSON object.

username.description: The username to use for basic authentication.

password.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

bearer_token.description: The bearer token to use for bearer token authentication.

api_key.description: The API key to use for API key authentication.

mtls_cert.description: The certificate to use for mTLS authentication.

mtls_key.description: The key to use for mTLS authentication.

mtls_ca.description: The CA to use for mTLS authentication.

client_id.description: The client ID to use for Oauth2 authentication.

client_secret.description: The client secret to use for Oauth2 authentication.

scopes.description: The scope to use for Oauth2 authentication. Provide a comma-separated list of scopes.

oauth2_audience.description: The audience to use for Oauth2 authentication.

api_resource_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the api-resource resource

username.description: The username of the authenticated user.

access_token.description: The token to use for authentication.

github_pull_request_resource_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the github-pull-request-resource resource

access_token.description: The token to use for authentication.

github_repo_resource_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the github-repo-resource resource

raw_text_resource_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the raw-text-resource resource

resource_credential.title: resource Credential
resource_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

simple_task_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the simple-task task

structured_task_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the structured-task task

task_credential.title: task Credential
task_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

index_repo_username.description: The username to use when cloning the mono repository.

index_repo_password.description: The password to use when cloning the mono repository.

coding_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the coding-tool tool

excalidraw_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the excalidraw-tool tool

github_board_ticket_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the github-board-ticket-tool tool

client_id.description: The client ID for the Google Drive API.

client_secret.description: The client secret for the Google Drive API.

oauth2_audience.description: The audience for the OAuth2 token.

google_drive_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the google-drive-tool tool

client_id.description: The client ID for the Google Slides API.

client_secret.description: The client secret for the Google Slides API.

oauth2_audience.description: The audience for the OAuth2 token.

google_slides_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the google-slides-tool tool

message_channel_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the message-channel-tool tool

openapi_channel_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the openapi-channel-tool tool

custom_headers.description: Custom headers to include in the request. Provide a JSON object.

username.description: The username to use for basic authentication.

password.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

bearer_token.description: Bearer token to use for Oauth2 authentication.

client_id.description: The client ID to use for Oauth2 Client Credentials authentication.

client_secret.description: The client secret to use for Oauth2 Client Credentials authentication.

scope.description: The scope to use for Oauth2 Client Credentials authentication.

web_service_tool_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the web-service-tool tool

tool_credential.title: tool Credential
tool_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

github_board_tracker_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the github-board-tracker tracker

app_secret.description: The secret used to verify the webhook

trello_tracker_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the trello-tracker tracker

tracker_credential.title: tracker Credential
tracker_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

ai_worker_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the ai-worker worker

human_worker_credential.description: The sensitive variables for the human-worker worker

worker_credential.title: worker Credential
worker_credential.description: A secure storage mechanism for sensitive variables used in integrations. Values are stored with row-level encryption and are always encrypted in transit.

channel_id.description: The Discord channel to send messages to

channel_name.description: A unique name for the channel

anonymous_access.description: Allow anonymous access to the channel

voice_enabled.description: Enable voice input for the channel

oauth2_issuer_uri.description: Tokens from this issuer will be accepted

oauth2_claims.description: A JSON object containing the claims to be verified

channel_id.description: The Slack channel to send messages to

desiredTokens.description: The desired number of tokens to generate.

maxTokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

model.description: The name of the model to use for embedding.

repo.description: The name(slug) of the Github repository to use.

file_regex.description: The regex to use to match the files in the repository.

owner.description: The name(slug) of owner of the Github repository.

model.description: The name of the model to use for embedding.

schema_url.description: A URL to a valid OpenAPI schema.

fetch_path.description: The path to use for fetching data from the API.

fetch_method.description: The HTTP method to use for fetching data from the API.

webhook_path.description: The path that defines the webhook endpoint.

create_path.description: The path to use for creating new objects in the API.

create_method.description: The HTTP method to use for creating new objects in the API.

repo.description: The name(slug) of the Github repository to use.

owner.description: The name(slug) of owner of the Github repository.

repo.description: The name(slug) of the Github repository to use.

owner.description: The name(slug) of owner of the Github repository.

path_template.description: The path template to use to generate the path to the file. This can also just be the name of a particular or directory. Defaults to {{filename}}.

org_name.description: The name of the Github organization to use for webhooks.

webhooks_enabled.description: Whether to enable webhooks for this resource.

text.description: The text to use as the resource.

system_message_template.description: Template for a guidance message to steer the model.

acceptance_critera.description: The acceptance criteria for the task.

instructions.description: Instructions explaining to the worker how to complete the task.

context.description: Context that the worker should be aware of when completing the task.

definition_of_done.description: A set of conditions that must be met for the task to be considered done.

index_repo_location.description: A URL to a mono repository without the scheme. Example github.com/my/repo.

index_repo_branch.description: The branch of the mono repository to use.

mode.description: The mode to run the tool in.

server_url.description: The URL of the local server to run the tool on. Required if mode is local.

read_only.description: Whether the tool is read only.

org_name.description: The name of the Github Organization

project_name.description: The name of the Github Project

column_name.description: The name of the column where tickets should be placed

schema_url.description: A URL to a valid OpenAPI schema.
A URL to a valid OpenAPI schema.

template_schema_location.description: The location of the template schema.

board_name.description: The name of the Trello Board.

column_name.description: The name of the column to create the ticket in.

label.description: The name of the label to apply to the ticket.

url.description: The URL of the web service.

method.description: The HTTP method to use. Defaults to GET.

schema_url.description: A URL to a json schema with the request body schema.  Required if method is POST or PUT.

action_caption_webhook_base_url.description: The base URL to use for action caption webhooks.

username.description: The username to use for basic authentication.

org_name.description: The name of the Github Organization

project_name.description: The name of the Github Project

to_do_column.description: The name of the column where tickets should be pulled from or placed in.

in_progress_column.description: The name of the column for tickets that are currently being worked.

done_column.description: The column where tickets are put when they are done.

board_name.description: The name of the Trello Board

to_do_column.description: The name of the column where tickets should be pulled from or placed in.

in_progress_column.description: The name of the column for tickets that are currently being worked.

done_column.description: The column where tickets are put when they are done.

label.description: The name of the label to watch.

model.description: The name of the model to use for inference

temperature.description: The temperature parameter of the model, lower values are more deterministic, higher are more random.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate

top_p.description: The top P value to use.  Higher values are more deterministic, lower values are more chaotic.

user_id.description: The user id of the worker

object.title: Object
object.description: An object is a base object that all other objects inherit from.

id.description: The unique identifier for the object

orgId.description: The unique identifier for the organization the object belongs to.

credential.description: The name of the credential to use for this object.

credential_object.title: Credential Object
credential_object.description: A credential object is a base object that all other credential objects inherit from.

id.description: The unique identifier for the object

orgId.description: The unique identifier for the organization the object belongs to.

tool_reference.title: Tool Reference
tool_reference.description: A tool reference is a reference to a tool that can be used in a task.

subtask.title: Subtask
subtask.description: A subtask is a reference to a task that can be performed as part of a larger task. Subtasks provide their own context and can be useful for creating large, complex tasks without overloading the context window.
